Eco-Friendly Copier Upgrade and Replacement

June 20, 2025 Marga Enterprises

Technology plays a big role in sustainabilityâ€”and even office equipment like copiers can have a significant environmental impact. Outdated copiers often consume more energy, use inefficient printing methods, and lack features that support waste reduction. Thatâ€™s why more businesses are now prioritizing eco-friendly copier upgrade and replacement as part of their green strategy.

In this blog, weâ€™ll discuss why upgrading your copier matters, how to choose eco-friendly replacements, and what steps to take for proper disposal and reporting.

ðŸ‘‰ Start with this helpful guide on Eco-Friendly Copier Upgrade and Replacement

Why Upgrade Your Copier?

Older copiers may still function, but they often fall short in energy efficiency and sustainability. If your machine is more than five years old, it likely lacks modern features that help save:

  • Electricity

  • Paper

  • Toner

  • Time

Upgrading to an eco-friendly model improves performance while reducing your officeâ€™s environmental footprint.

Signs Itâ€™s Time for an Upgrade

Here are clear indicators that your current copier needs to be replaced:

  • High energy consumption despite low usage

  • Frequent breakdowns or maintenance calls

  • No duplex (double-sided) printing feature

  • No toner-saving or eco-mode options

  • Limited connectivity or outdated drivers

Modern copiers offer better automation, digital integration, and sustainability featuresâ€”all of which contribute to smoother workflows and greener practices.

Key Features of Eco-Friendly Copiers

When selecting a new copier, look for models that include:

âœ… ENERGY STARÂ® Certification

Devices certified by ENERGY STARÂ® consume significantly less energy.

âœ… Automatic Duplex Printing

Prints on both sides by default, saving paper.

âœ… Toner-Saving Mode

Reduces the amount of toner used per print, extending cartridge life.

âœ… Sleep and Auto-Off Modes

Conserves energy when the machine is idle.

âœ… Recyclable Components

Built with sustainable materials and designed for easy disassembly.

Disposal: What to Do With the Old Copier?

Replacing a copier means deciding what to do with the old one. Simply tossing it out is not only wasteful but may also violate e-waste disposal regulations.

Hereâ€™s what you should do instead:

  • Partner with vendors who offer take-back programs

  • Donate still-working units to schools or nonprofits

  • Work with certified e-waste recyclers

ðŸ‘‰ Follow these sustainable copier disposal practices to ensure responsible handling of old machines.

Planning the Transition: Step-by-Step

1. Assess Your Office Needs

Before upgrading, determine your print volume, network setup, and any specific document handling requirements. This helps you choose a copier thatâ€™s right-sized for your team.

2. Select a Certified Green Vendor

Work with a vendor that specializes in eco-friendly copier rentals or purchases. Ask about maintenance support, energy ratings, and recycling programs.

3. Schedule Training for Your Team

Once installed, make sure your team knows how to use the copier efficiently. Teaching staff about duplex settings, sleep mode, and digital scan features maximizes your sustainability investment.

ðŸ‘‰ Use this training on eco-friendly copier usage to make onboarding easy.

4. Document and Report the Upgrade

Keep a record of the upgradeâ€”when it happened, what model was replaced, and the environmental benefits expected. This supports ESG and sustainability reports.

ðŸ‘‰ Learn more about documentation and reporting for sustainability.

Real-World Impact: What Businesses Are Achieving

In a recent case study, a company replaced five outdated copiers with ENERGY STARÂ®-certified models. Over 12 months, they saw:

  • 35% reduction in electricity usage

  • 40% drop in paper consumption due to default duplex settings

  • Improved productivity from fewer breakdowns

Final Thoughts

An eco-friendly copier upgrade and replacement isnâ€™t just a tech decisionâ€”itâ€™s a sustainability commitment. By choosing smarter devices and disposing of old ones responsibly, your business can significantly reduce waste, save on energy costs, and support long-term environmental goals.

From planning the upgrade to training your team and reporting results, each step helps build a greener, more efficient workplace.
